channel.title: How to u make item only avaiable to playerrights =3
channel.description: how can umake an item only available to owner [playerrights=3]

item.source: How to u make item only avaiable to playerrights =3

item.title: How to u make item only avaiable to playerrights =3
item.dc:creator: @yar_nova yar nova
item.description:
@yar_nova wrote:

instead of

else if (NPCID == NPC ID Here && checkmemb() == true) { PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = Shop ID Here;//Vullage Helmet Shop }
use

else if (NPCID == NPC ID Here) { if(checkmemb() == true) { PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = Shop ID Here; } else { sendMessage("You need to be a member to shop here."); } }

Read full topic
item.source: How to u make item only avaiable to playerrights =3

item.title: How to u make item only avaiable to playerrights =3
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“yar nova, post:31, topic:121656”]Yes, for shops heres the code:
in shops find

else if (NPCID == 553) { //Aubury rune shop PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = 2; //Aubury Magic Shop }

and under it add:

else if (NPCID == NPC ID Here && checkmemb() == true) { PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = Shop ID Here;//Vullage Helmet Shop }
and that makes a members shop.

If you want to have objects(gates etc.) that you can only use if your a member just search for

ObjectID == ID Of Members Object Here

right below that it add

if(checkmemb()==true) {

and after the last } add another

}

And the object is members only![/quote]

he/she didn’t tell you exactly where it says “NPC ID here” your surpose to exactly do that put the npc id of the shop in
if you didn’t notice (and if you forgot you have to add the shop in “shops.cfg” and autospawn to spawn the npc to access the shop.)

ya nova, some people are wrong. That is not me. Obviously YOU are wrong!

Read full topic

item.title: How to u make item only avaiable to playerrights =3
item.dc:creator: @yar_nova yar nova
item.description:
@yar_nova wrote:

[quote=“xxl3th4lxx, post:39, topic:121656”]ahh, its
0 = non mod(player)
1 = mod
2 = admin
3 = owner[/quote]

Heres extra info and proof from some server sources:

//start of moderator/admin list, 1 = mod, 2 = staff, 3 = admin
public int playerRights; // 0=normal player, 1=player mod, 2=real mod, 3=admin

find

IPPart1 = Integer.parseInt(playerLastConnect.substring(0, start[0]));

if(checkmemb()==true) { sendMessage("You are a member."); }

item.title: How to u make item only avaiable to playerrights =3
item.dc:creator: @yar_nova yar nova
item.description:
@yar_nova wrote:

Yes, for shops heres the code:
in shops find

else if (NPCID == 553) { //Aubury rune shop PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = 2; //Aubury Magic Shop }

and under it add:

else if (NPCID == NPC ID Here && checkmemb() == true) { PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = Shop ID Here;//Vullage Helmet Shop }
and that makes a members shop.

If you want to have objects(gates etc.) that you can only use if your a member just search for

ObjectID == ID Of Members Object Here

right below that it add

if(checkmemb()==true) {

and after the last } add another

}

And the object is members only!

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @yar_nova yar nova
item.description:
@yar_nova wrote:

[quote=“delta, post:26, topic:121656”]client.java:12943: incompatible types
found : int
required: boolean
boolean memonly = GetMO(wearID);
^
client.java:13095: incompatible types
found : boolean
required: int
return false;
^
client.java:13098: incompatible types
found : boolean
required: int
return true;
^
client.java:13100: incompatible types
found : boolean
required: int
return false;
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
4 errors
Files Compiled Successfully!
Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]

Oops lol… It’s public boolean GetMO not public int GetMO… Fixed, just change int GetMO to boolean GetMO

Read full topic

item.title: How to u make item only avaiable to playerrights =3
item.dc:creator: @yar_nova yar nova
item.description:
@yar_nova wrote:

[quote=“xxl3th4lxx, post:23, topic:121656”]for(i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) { if(playerItems[i] == 7954 && playerRights >= 3) { deleteItem(7954, GetItemSlot(7954), 1); } }
wouldn’t that just delete the item if your a admin with it?[/quote]
no its soposed to be < 3 not >= 3

delta i’ve finished that code, here try this one:

public boolean checkmemb() { try { BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("data/membership.txt")); String data = null; while ((data = in.readLine()) != null) { if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(data)) { return true; } } } catch (IOException e) { System.out.println("Critical error while checking starts!"); e.printStackTrace(); } return false; }

find:

public boolean wear(int wearID, int slot) {

under

int CLRanged = GetCLRanged(wearID);
add

boolean memonly = GetMO(wearID);

under

if (CLRanged > playerLevel[playerRanged]) { sendMessage("You need " + CLRanged + " " + statName[playerRanged] + " to equip this item."); GoFalse = true; }
add

if (memonly == true && checkmemb() == false) { sendMessage("You need to be a member to equip this item."); GoFalse = true; }

add this boolean:

public boolean GetMO(int ItemID) { if (ItemID == -1) { return false; } else if(ItemID == 6570) { return true; } return false; }

change 6570 to the ID of the members only item, add more by adding more

else if(ItemID == ID Here) { return true; }
under the

else if(ItemID == 6570) { return true; }
or whatever you changed it to.

What this will do is make it where you can’t wear the item unless your a member.

Read full topic
